a104-1.resolution: R#214 (s1232) identified root cause: inline-intel-capture.mjs tagged entries with session=0 because SESSION_NUM env var was unavailable. Fix: session-context.mjs backfills session numbers from trace archive + inline-intel-capture.mjs accepts --session CLI arg. All 5 recent E sessions now pass d049.
a104-1.metric_before: d049 compliance at 40% (2/5 E sessions) at A#104
a104-1.metric_after: d049 compliance at 100% (5/5) — s1213: 1 entry PASS, s1218: 1 entry PASS, s1223: 3 entries PASS, s1228: 3 entries PASS, s1233: 5 entries PASS.
a104-1.note: The 4-audit degradation pattern (80%→67%→50%→40%) was a measurement bug, not a behavioral failure. Intel WAS being captured but tagged with session=0, making per-session verification count them as 0. R#214 backfill fix resolved this. wq-438 emergency can be downgraded.

a104-2.resolution: B#368 (s1234, commit 2ce732b) added explicit prohibition to SESSION_BUILD.md line 267: 'NEVER modify audit-report.json — only A sessions own audit state files.' References B#367 false resolution and wq-439.
a104-2.metric_before: No SESSION_BUILD.md prohibition on audit-report.json modification
a104-2.metric_after: Explicit prohibition in SESSION_BUILD.md with context about B#367 incident
a104-2.note: Structural guardrail in place. B sessions now have a clear rule against modifying audit state.

d049_compliance.note: RESET. R#214 (s1232) found root cause was session=0 tagging bug. All 5 recent E sessions pass d049 at 100%. Previous 4-audit degradation pattern was measurement error. Escalation resolved.

d049_compliance.trend: RECOVERED: 40%→100%. Root cause (session=0 tagging) fixed by R#214.

intel_volume.note: All 5 recent E sessions producing intel. Average 2.6 entries per session.

intel.verdict: HEALTHY — d049 at 100%, intel volume trending up.

unacted: d045 (external blocker — credential regeneration awaiting E session)

security.verdict: CLEAN — d045 ongoing external blocker, no active threats.

cost.trend: DECREASING — down 12% from $1.75 to $1.54 avg in second half

cost.note: All sessions within budget caps. B session avg $2.15 justified by build output (avg 3.4 commits). No sessions over $3 or under $0.30.

recommended_actions.description: Downgrade wq-438 from emergency to done/monitoring. d049 compliance is now 100% (5/5 E sessions). R#214 root cause fix (session=0 tagging) is verified effective. The hr-104-1 human review item should also be updated to reflect resolution.
recommended_actions.action: B session should update wq-438 status to done with resolution note. Update human-review.json hr-104-1 to resolved.

recommended_actions.description: B session avg cost $2.15 is above $2.00 threshold (7 sessions). While currently justified by build output (avg 3.4 commits), trend should be monitored. If B sessions continue above $2.00 for 2 more audits without proportional output increase, investigate prompt size or hook overhead.
recommended_actions.action: Monitor B session costs next audit. No action needed if output remains proportional.
